Xu Shen, Wu Cheng, Rong Geng, Zhang Shi-chao " Dan " character as the sun rose out of the ground in the shape, according to the inscriptions, ancient coins, ancient seals text or from the " Day " next, " D " on provable " Dan " character The sound of " ding " is more reasonable. The inscriptions on the inscriptions are filled from the side of the " Ding " to the bottom of the small seal, which is more like the shape of the ground.

The oracle bone inscriptions are used as the original meaning to indicate dawn and morning, and "Compilation" 21025: "Heavy Rain in Xinhai Day", which means heavy rain on the morning of Xinhai Day. "The Story of the Ram. "Thirteen Years of Aigong": "Seen in Danye." He Xiu's note: "Dan, the day is out." "Compilation" 29272: "Dan is faint without rain", which means that there is no rain from morning to dusk. Bronze inscriptions are also used as the original meaning, this tripod: "Dan, Wang Ge (Ge) Da (tai) room." It means that the king of Zhou came to the Tai room at dawn.

The bamboo slips of the Warring States Period were used as the original meaning, "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Slips. Simplified 233: "Qingdan", which means early morning.

"Shu Wen": "Dan, Ming Ye. From the day, see one above. One, the land. Every dan belongs to the Dan." Wang Yun "Shu Wen Shi Lian": "The sea of my hear: Day When it first appeared, it was swallowed by the sea air, like a fire like a flower, under the sun." "I live in the land, and the sunrise is similar to what I said, but the rusticity is not as big as the big ears of water and air."

"Qing Yun Ge": "The sun and the moon are shining, and once Fudan is coming." It means that the brilliance of the sun and the moon will continue. " Dan " means dawn, and "Dan Fudan" means dawn and dawn.

humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「日」，「丁」聲(于省吾)，象早上太陽剛剛昇起，本義是天明、日出時分。許慎、吳大澂、容庚、張世超認為「旦」字象太陽升出地面之形，按金文、古幣、古璽文字或從「日」在下，「丁」在上，可證「旦」字從「丁」聲較為合理。金文所從「丁」旁填實，至小篆改從一橫在下，比較象地面之形。

　　甲骨文用作本義，表示天明、早晨，《合集》21025：「辛亥旦大雨」，表示辛亥這一日早晨下大雨。《公羊傳．哀公十三年》：「見于旦也。」何休注：「旦者，日方出時。」《合集》29272：「旦至于昏不雨」，表示早晨至黃昏都沒有下雨。金文亦用作本義，此鼎：「旦，王各(格)大(太)室。」意謂天明的時候，周王來到太室。

　　戰國竹簡用作本義，《睡虎地秦簡．日書乙種》簡233：「清旦」，表示清晨。

　　《說文》：「旦，明也。从日，見一上。一，地也。凡旦之屬皆从旦。」王筠《說文釋例》：「吾聞之海人云：日之初出，為海氣所吞吐，如火如花，承日之下。」「余居土國，日出亦近似所言，但土氣不如水氣之大耳。」

　　〈卿云歌〉：「日月光華，旦復旦兮。」意即太陽、月亮的光華綿延下去，「旦」表示天明，「旦復旦」即天明後又天明。
humanum_short_description: 甲金文象早上太陽剛剛昇起，本義是日出。

[①]［dàn］
［《廣韻》得按切，去翰，端。］
(1)天亮。
(2)清晨；早晨。
(3)天；某日。
(4)特指农历初一日。
(5)明亮。
(6)指生日。

(8)乐曲声调名。
(9)通“鴠”。鸟名。
